intro: Pogostemon jaitapurensis, commonly known as the Jaitapur pogostemon, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
